title: Wikipedia now labels the top Jewish civil rights group as an unreliable source
message:
Wikipedia’s editors declared that the Anti-Defamation League cannot be trusted to give reliable information on the Israel-Palestine conflict, and they overwhelmingly said the ADL is an unreliable source on antisemitism.
That means that the ADL should usually not be cited in Wikipedia articles on that topic except for extraordinary circumstances.
Other generally unreliable sources, according to Wikipedia editors, include Russian state media, Fox News’ political coverage and Amazon reviews.
The ADL also faces a vote from Wikipedia editors to potentially label the organization as unreliable on the topic of antisemitism.

event_breakdown: In recent years, instances of antisemitism have been on the rise worldwide, with global antisemitism reaching an all-time high in 2021. Instances include vandalism of Jewish cemeteries and synagogues, as well as physical assaults against Jews. In October 2018, 11 people were killed at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh. In 2019, a Jewish man was stabbed near Paris. In 2020, a Hasidic man was shot several times in New York. These incidents have prompted an outpouring of grief, solidarity, and activism from people around the world.

title: This is how Jewish teens from far - flung places handle antisemitism
message:
Burgos said meeting Jewish teens from around the world helped him appreciate how different Jewish life looks in each country.
JTA also spoke to teens from Montenegro, Moldova and China to hear about Jewish life back home — from Jewish rituals to weathering various levels of antisemitism.
The lack of Jewish community in Montenegro has made Kovacevic appreciate the opportunity to attend BBYO events even more.
“Only three of my friends came with me in our Jewish community, but many people in Moldova have Jewish roots.”Sinkariova said leaders from the local Jewish community have come to present at school, teaching students about Jewish life and the contributions Jews have made in society.
In the days immediately following Russia’s invasion, many Ukrainian Jewish evacuees took refuge in Moldova’s synagogues and Jewish community centers.

title: JPMorgan employee on leave , under investigation after tearing down Israeli hostages poster
message:
A JPMorgan Chase employee is on leave after video surfaced on social media of her tearing down a poster of Israeli hostages, the company told The National Desk (TND) Thursday.
The , shared by Jewish advocacy group StopAntisemitism, depicts a woman peeling an image of missing Israeli hostages off a light post in New York City.
We do not tolerate violence, hate, divisiveness or discrimination,” a company spokesperson told TND Thursday.
The employee has been put on immediate leave while we investigate the matter.”Liora Rez, the founder and executive director of StopAntisemitism, told TND the group wants to "acknowledge and thank" JPMorgan Chase for "quickly stepping in."

A Labour candidate for the town council elections has caused offense by posting an illustration of a snake with an Israeli Star of David on it.
5. Anti-Semitic rally in Poland
A far-right demonstration organized on Poland's Independence Day sparked controversy by repeating slogans used by the country's antisemitic organization ONR.

title: Head of Anti - Semitic Group Calls To Expel Zionists from New York City
message:
The leader of an anti-Israel activist group on Wednesday called to expel supporters of the Jewish state from the city, while criticizing the New York Police Department’s efforts to track down a man who threatened and tried to identify "Zionists" on a subway car.
Kiswani's comments come just over a week after viral video of an anti-Semitic incident on a subway car in the city sparked national controversy and an NYPD investigation.
While Kiswani endorsed the subway protester's call to expel Zionists, an article in the New Republic attempted to downplay the chant as merely a joke.
The subhead reads, "It seems disinformation about recent pro-Palestine protests has made it all the way to the White House."
This is your chance to get out,' a nod to the density of pro-Palestine protesters on the subway train."
